content.question: Which syntactic structure is correct?
content.correctAnswer: Not only does he sing, but he also dances.
wrongAnswers: Not only he sings, but he also dances.
Not only sings he, but also dances.
Not only he does sing, but also dances.
content.explanation: This sentence demonstrates advanced grammar, vocabulary, or logic typically expected at C1/C2 levels.
